Title: Helene victims get lower priority that foreign aid

Fact vs Fiction.Desc: They’re offering them $750, to people whose homes have been washed away. And yet we send tens of billions of dollars to foreign countries that most people have never heard of. They’re offering them $750. They’ve been destroyed, these people have been destroyed. Think of it: We give foreign countries hundreds of billions of dollars and we’re handing North Carolina $750.

Analysis.Statement: They’re offering them $750 to people whose homes have been washed away.
Analysis.Rationale: The $750 is under the Federal Emergency Management Agency’s Serious Needs Assistance program, which covers immediate needs after a disaster, including food, water, baby formula, breastfeeding supplies, medication and other emergency supplies. Through this program, the White House said, FEMA paid out more than $1 million to more than 1,400 North Carolina households within a day.

As of date Total Housing Assistance (HA) Dollars Approved $7,402,361.32, Total Other Needs Assistance (ONA) Dollars Approved $30,056,948.09, Total Individual and Households Program Dollars Approved $37,459,309.41. Individual Assistance Applications Approved 28,485. Amounting to $1300 approximately per application. Additional funding is in the process of being approved.

Analysis.Statement: And yet we send tens of billions of dollars to foreign countries that most people have never heard of.
Analysis.Rationale: Ukraine has received a total of $174 Billion since 2021 January, due to the Russian invasion, covering military, economic, and humanitarian needs.

Analysis.Statement: Think of it: We give foreign countries hundreds of billions of dollars
Analysis.Rationale: More than $140 billion has been provided to countries like Ethiopia, Afghanistan, Yemen, Jordan, and Egypt (more than $1 billion each year during this period) mostly for humanitarian and military purposes.
